gurmukhi: gurmuiK mwrg huie duibDw Brm Koey crn srin ghy inj Gir Awey hY
transliteration: Gurmukhi Maarag Hui Doubidhaa Bharam Khoay , Charan Sarani Gahay Nij Ghari Aaay Hai ?
translation: Entering the path of Sikhism destroys suspicions and separatism and by the support of Satguru, one realises self.

gurmukhi: drs dris idib diRsit pRgws BeI AMmiRq ktwC kY Amr pd pwey hY
transliteration: Daras Darasi Dibi Drisati Pragaas Bhaee , Anmrit Kataachh Kai Amar Pad Paaay Hai ?
translation: By the glimpse of Satguru, one is blessed with a vision that enables one see the Lord all around oneself. By the clement look of Satguru, one achieves eternal position.

gurmukhi: sbd suriq Anhd inJr Jrn ismrn mMqR ilv aunmn Cwey hY
transliteration: Sabad Surati Anahad Nijhar Jharana , Simaran Mantr Liv Ounaman Chhaaay Hai ?
translation: By the union of word and consciousness and by virtue of the sweet tune of Naam, a perpetual flow of divine elixir starts flowing. By continuous repetition of Guru-given incantation, higher spiritual state is achieved.

gurmukhi: mn bc kRm huie iekqR gurmuK suK pRym nym ibsm ibs√çws aupjwey hY ]89]
transliteration: Man Bach Kram Hui Ikatr Gurmoukh Soukha , Praym Naym Bisam Bisvaas Oupajaaay Hai ?89?
translation: A Guru-conscious person attains real spiritual comfort and peace by bringing in harmony between mind, words and deeds. That unique tradition of Lord's love breeds a wonderful confidence and faith in his mind. (89)
